name: places/ChIJBVbUZAdZwokRe04fNmDP2Xs
formattedAddress: 197 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 197 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text: Stumbled across this place and they were so kind and knowledgeable about glasses. They have a great inventory of designer frames and even these frames from Japan that I loved. I was worried about finding a pair of designer frames with my low nose bridge. Found so many great options. Prices are very reasonable. Never thought finding glasses would be so fun till I came here.

text.text: Stumbled across this place and they were so kind and knowledgeable about glasses. They have a great inventory of designer frames and even these frames from Japan that I loved. I was worried about finding a pair of designer frames with my low nose bridge. Found so many great options. Prices are very reasonable. Never thought finding glasses would be so fun till I came here.

originalText.text: I bought a pair of glasses here 4 years ago, and they're still working as expected. The reason I returned back was because the glasses were beginning to leave marks on my nose bridge. I mentioned this to Kamal who immediately helped me by adjusting the nose pads. I also noticed that he cleaned my glasses too. Lastly all of this was done free of charge. Thank you Kamal for everything!

text.text: I bought a pair of glasses here 4 years ago, and they're still working as expected. The reason I returned back was because the glasses were beginning to leave marks on my nose bridge. I mentioned this to Kamal who immediately helped me by adjusting the nose pads. I also noticed that he cleaned my glasses too. Lastly all of this was done free of charge. Thank you Kamal for everything!

originalText.text: My right nose pad screw was loose and the owner gladly fixed it for me free-of-charge and tightened the left one as well. Thanks, Eyes on Madison.

text.text: My right nose pad screw was loose and the owner gladly fixed it for me free-of-charge and tightened the left one as well. Thanks, Eyes on Madison.

originalText.text: Best eyewear shop in New York, not just the quality of work but the outstanding of customer service, you will never feel the difference unless you deal with other eyewear shops who act like they doing you a favor plus the insane price they have, I highly recommend that eyewear store, Ask for Mr. Kamal he is the one who made my eyeglass which he even explained to me all details and every question I asked patiently..

text.text: Best eyewear shop in New York, not just the quality of work but the outstanding of customer service, you will never feel the difference unless you deal with other eyewear shops who act like they doing you a favor plus the insane price they have, I highly recommend that eyewear store, Ask for Mr. Kamal he is the one who made my eyeglass which he even explained to me all details and every question I asked patiently..

originalText.text:
Initially I was very happy here. They were attentive, mindful of my disabilities, and respectful of covid safety. I got the frames I needed. Things were good.

I was annoyed that the salesman, on my multiple visits, refused to ever let me finish a sentence without talking over me (often being wrong about what the other half of the sentence would have been), but I tried to let it roll off my back.

I was upsold on the lenses. He put me down for all the extras without even really asking. (The next time I came back, even he was impressed with how much he'd tacked on.) But I didn't object because I use my glasses every day, and the extras are probably worth it.

The real problem came with the warranty. They were very squirrelly about that. Didn't want to give me anything in writing. When I came back because I needed documentation, they went off to have a whispered conversation about how much they could give me, and reluctantly scribbled "1 year warranty" on the receipt and refused to give anything more. What followed was months of lies, evasions, and broken promises. And now I'm out $200 that could have been reimbursed if they'd been less sketchy and more cooperative.
